reporting_cycle: Secretary-General/Panel of Experts reports: interim by 1 December 2019, final by 1 May 2020, and monthly updates
summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on South Sudan, determines that the situation in South Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, it:

1. Renews until 31 May 2020 measures imposed by paragraphs 9 and 12 of resolution 2206 (2015), and reaffirms related provisions.

2. Renews until 31 May 2020 measures imposed by paragraph 4 of resolution 2428 (2018), and reaffirms related provisions.

3. Extends until 30 June 2020 the mandate of the Panel of Experts, which is to provide an interim report by 1 December 2019, a final report by 1 May 2020, and monthly updates.

4. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
